description: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the uterus, grade II/III, with superficial myometrial invasion (<20%) and no lymph node or extrauterine involvement. Surgical staging revealed pT1a pN0 pM0 corresponding to FIGO stage IA.
patient_notes: You have an early-stage endometrial cancer called endometrioid adenocarcinoma that has invaded only the superficial layer of the uterine muscle and has not spread to lymph nodes. You have had a total hysterectomy with removal of your ovaries and fallopian tubes. Because of the high-grade cells, we recommend a vaginal radiation treatment called brachytherapy to help reduce the risk of recurrence.

verification.assessment: FIGO stage IA is correct, but the pathologic T category was misclassified as pT1b instead of pT1a based on <20% myometrial invasion.

cancer_organ_type.issues: Value 'Uterine cancer' does not match the exact NCCN organ type nomenclature.

pathologic_stage.issues: Report describes <20% myometrial invasion, which is pT1a rather than pT1b.

description.issues: Pathologic stage is incorrectly stated as pT1b; description should reflect pT1a.

change_explanations.cancer_organ_type: Changed from 'Uterine cancer' to 'Uterine Neoplasms'. Reason: Value 'Uterine cancer' does not match the exact NCCN organ type nomenclature.
change_explanations.pathologic_stage: Changed from 'pT1b pN0 pM0' to 'pT1a pN0 pM0'. Reason: Report describes <20% myometrial invasion, which is pT1a rather than pT1b.
